dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2091 RH: Child Support Assistance Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Poliquin (for himself, Mr. Ellison, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Mr. Duffy, Mr. Murphy of Florida, and Mrs. Wagner) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to clarify the ability to request consumer reports in certain cases to establish and enforce child support payments and awards.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Child Support Assistance Act of 2015.

section.header: Requests for consumer reports by State or local child support enforcement agencies
section.text: Paragraph (4) of section 604(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681b(a)(4)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking or determining the appropriate level of such payments and inserting , determining the appropriate level of such payments, or enforcing a child support order, award, agreement, or judgment;

subparagraph.text: by striking paternity and inserting parentage; and
by adding and at the end;

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
